item.title: Overwatch Rush Is a Brand New Mobile Hero Shooter from Blizzard
item.content:encoded:
Blizzard has revealed Overwatch Rush, a brand new top-down hero shooter "set in the Overwatch universe", and it's currently in active development, although there's no release date yet.

In a news post on the official Blizzard website, the studio describes Overwatch Rush as a new game "designed specifically for mobile" and developed by a "dedicated team" with "deep mobile experience". The company also released an in-development gameplay preview to show off what Overwatch Rush will offer.

According to Blizzard, the team working on Overwatch Rush is separate from Overwatch's Team 4, which remains "fully focused" on the main game. Testing in select countries and regions should begin soon, Blizzard says.

By the looks of the trailer, Overwatch Rush will share some of its DNA with games like League of Legends: Wild Rift and Pokemon Unite, although it's worth noting that Blizzard doesn't describe the game as a MOBA.

It'll feature recognizable Overwatch heroes like Mercy, Reinhardt, and Soldier 76, and like the main game, it looks like gameplay will revolve around contesting objectives in fast-paced shootouts, although this time from a top-down perspective.

We don't know too much else about Overwatch Rush yet, except that Blizzard says that there's still "a lot of work to do" on the game, and that you should check out the official Discord server if you want to keep up with the newly-announced project's progress.

You can take a look at the debut trailer for Overwatch Rush, which shows off what the gameplay will look like and how some of the heroes in the game will play, right here.

Overwatch Rush's announcement comes after a major relaunch for the original Overwatch, which saw Blizzard dropping the "2" from the title and reverting to just "Overwatch", as well as the launch of several new heroes and more.

We'll have to wait and see what comes of Overwatch Rush, but it could be a little while before Blizzard reveals more about this one. Stay tuned for more.
